definition: rice cake (typically made with glutinous rice flour and steamed)

sentences.english: Another stall which JAF always patronise at the same hawker centre is this Char Kway Teow stall.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个找食趣常光顾的摊位就是这档炒粿条了。

sentences.english: We were most excited that the dish came with cockles.
sentences.chinese: 最让我们感到兴奋的是粿条里面有蚶。

sentences.english: After this puja, tea and refreshments will be served.
sentences.chinese: 另法会期间，会有茶及富饶饭粿奉用。

sentences.english: We ordered the Char Kway Teow and Penang Hokkien Prawn Mee.
sentences.chinese: 点了炒粿条和槟城福建虾面试试看。

sentences.english: This is my easy version of Mee Hun Kuay's recipe.
sentences.chinese: 这是我认为最简单的面粉粿食谱。

sentences.english: A cheerful heart involves thought process, feelings and behaviors.
sentences.chinese: 一粿喜乐的心是包括我们的思想，感觉及行为。

sentences.english: In the end, he gives comments on this rice making art.
sentences.chinese: 最后以粿印的文化艺术省思作一总结。

definition: (Hakka cuisine) snacks made from glutinous rice flour (rice cakes, noodles etc)
nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
fried radish cake (a type of dim sum, commonly called "turnip cake")
yam paste (a snack in Chaozhou cuisine)
soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
